abstract: Five lawsuits filed against John Does on Thursday will give the software company subpoena power to help track down purveyors of Internet malware.
snippet: Five lawsuits filed against John Does on Thursday will give the software company subpoena power to help track down purveyors of Internet malware.
lead_paragraph: Stepping up an effort to unmask online attackers responsible for a wave of malicious advertisements aimed at Windows PC users, Microsoft on Thursday filed suit in Washington state Superior Court against the unknown individuals behind five companies that it alleges distributed “malvertising” that entangled its customers in fake-antivirus scams and infected them with other malicious software.

headline.main: Microsoft Chases Unknown Scammers Through the Courts
